ca.eandb.jmist.framework.material.biospec

Class ABMInterfaceMaterial

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.eandb.jmist.framework.material.AbstractMaterial
      • ca.eandb.jmist.framework.material.OpaqueMaterial
        • ca.eandb.jmist.framework.material.biospec.ABMInterfaceMaterial
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Material, Medium, Serializable

    public final class ABMInterfaceMaterial
extends OpaqueMaterial
    A Material that represents an interface between two layers in the ABM-U or ABM-B implementation.
    Author:
    Brad Kimmel
    See Also:
    ABMMaterial, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ABMInterfaceMaterial

        public ABMInterfaceMaterial(double riBelow,
                            double riAbove,
                            double n11,
                            double n12,
                            double n21,
                            double n22)
        Creates a new ABMInterfaceSurfaceScatterer.
        Parameters:
        riBelow - The refractive index of the medium above the interface.
        riAbove - The refractive index of the medium below the interface.
        n11 - The perturbation exponent used for a ray reflected from the top side of the interface.
        n12 - The perturbation exponent used for a ray transmitted from the top side to the bottom side of the interface.
        n21 - The perturbation exponent used for a ray transmitted from the bottom side to the top side of the interface.
        n22 - The perturbation exponent used for a ray reflected from the bottom side of the interface.

    • Method Detail

      • scatter

        public Vector3 scatter(SurfacePointGeometry x,
                       Vector3 v,
                       boolean adjoint,
                       double lambda,
                       Random rnd)

      • scatter

        public ScatteredRay scatter(SurfacePoint x,
                            Vector3 v,
                            boolean adjoint,
                            WavelengthPacket lambda,
                            double ru,
                            double rv,
                            double rj)
        Description copied from interface: Material
        Scatters a ray incident on this material.
        Specified by:
        scatter in interface Material
        Overrides:
        scatter in class AbstractMaterial
        Parameters:
        x - The SurfacePoint that the ray is incident upon.
        v - The Vector3 indicating the direction of travel of the incident ray (note that the Vector3 points toward the surface).
        adjoint - A value indicating whether the path being simulated is in the reverse direction from the direction in which light is traveling (i.e., true for path tracing from the eye, false for light tracing).
        lambda - The WavelengthPacket associated with the light traveling along this path.
        ru - The first random variable (must be in [0, 1]).
        rv - The second random variable (must be in [0, 1]).
        rj - The third random variable (must be in [0, 1]).
        Returns:
        The ScatteredRay, or null to indicate that the ray was absorbed.
